name: Jeow Bong Recipe (Lao Chili Paste)
description: This jeow bong recipe is a delightful blend of spicy, umami, and slightly sweet flavors.

itemListElement.text: Start by roasting shallots and garlic in a dry pan until golden and fragrant. Then roast the kaffir lime leaves and chunks of galangal until they release their citrusy and earthy scents. Finally, roast the dry red chilies until they darken slightly for a smoky heat.
itemListElement.name: Start by roasting shallots and garlic in a dry pan until golden and fragrant. Then roast the kaffir lime leaves and chunks of galangal until they release their citrusy and earthy scents. Finally, roast the dry red chilies until they darken slightly for a smoky heat.

itemListElement.text: Pound the dried chilies in your mortar. Pound them into a fine powder.
itemListElement.name: Pound the dried chilies in your mortar. Pound them into a fine powder.

itemListElement.text: Add galangal and kaffir lime leaves. Pound until all the pieces are broken down, and the mixture is well blended.
itemListElement.name: Add galangal and kaffir lime leaves. Pound until all the pieces are broken down, and the mixture is well blended.

itemListElement.text: Pound in the shallots and garlic until you get a fragrant paste.
itemListElement.name: Pound in the shallots and garlic until you get a fragrant paste.

itemListElement.text: Heat oil in your pan over medium-low heat, then fry the paste, stirring gently. Pour in all sauces and water, continue frying until the paste has absorbed all liquid, and transform into a sticky chili paste ready for use.
